Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime import re print("=== RESEARCHING EMPERORS AND CATHEDRAL GALLERY EXPANSIONS ===") print("Objective: Find emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with encircling galleries") print("Focus: Holy Roman Empire period, distinctive gallery architecture") print("Target: Cathedrals with complete encircling galleries as first architectural innovation\n") # Create workspace directory workspace_dir = "workspace" os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # Get SerpAPI key from environment variables api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("Warning: No SERPAPI_API_KEY found. Will attempt alternative search methods.") use_serpapi = False else: print("‚úÖ SerpAPI key found, using Google Search API") use_serpapi = True print("\n=== STEP 1: TARGETED SEARCHES FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERY ARCHITECTURE ===") print("=" * 80) # Define comprehensive search queries focusing on cathedral galleries and emperors search_queries = [ "cathedral gallery encircling building Holy Roman Emperor", "first cathedral complete gallery architecture medieval", "Holy Roman Emperor cathedral expansion gallery construction", "medieval cathedral architectural innovations encircling gallery", "emperor commissioned cathedral gallery around entire building", "Charlemagne cathedral gallery architecture Aachen", "Otto Holy Roman Emperor cathedral construction gallery", "medieval cathedral gallery walkway encircling building", "first cathedral with complete encircling gallery innovation", "Holy Roman Empire cathedral architectural features gallery" ] all_search_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: '{query}'") print("-" * 70) if use_serpapi: try: # Use SerpAPI for comprehensive results params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 10, "type": "search" } response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() if results.get("organic_results"): print(f"‚úÖ Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results") for j, result in enumerate(results["organic_results"], 1): title = result.get('title', 'No title') link = result.get('link', 'No link') snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\nResult {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:200]}..." if len(snippet) > 200 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Store comprehensive result data all_search_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'search_method': 'serpapi' }) # FIXED: Define combined_text properly in the correct scope combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" key_terms = ['emperor', 'gallery', 'cathedral', 'encircling', 'charlemagne', 'otto', 'holy roman', 'aachen', 'architectural'] relevance_score = sum(1 for term in key_terms if term in combined_text) if relevance_score >= 4: print("üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE - Contains multiple key terms!") elif relevance_score >= 2: print("üìù Moderate relevance") print("-" * 40) else: print(f"‚ùå No results found for query: '{query}'") else: print(f"‚ùå SerpAPI error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå SerpAPI search error: {str(e)}") else: # Fallback to DuckDuckGo if SerpAPI not available try: from ddgs import DDGS searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) results = searcher.text(query, max_results=8, backend=["duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off") if results: print(f"‚úÖ Found {len(results)} results via DuckDuckGo") for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', 'No title') link = result.get('href', 'No link') snippet = result.get('body', 'No snippet') print(f"\nResult {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:200]}..." if len(snippet) > 200 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") all_search_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'search_method': 'duckduckgo' }) print("-" * 40) else: print(f"‚ùå No results found for query: '{query}'") except ImportError: print("‚ùå DuckDuckGo search not available, skipping this query") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå DuckDuckGo search error: {str(e)}") # Rate limiting time.sleep(2) print("\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS ===") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_search_results)}") print("=" * 60) # Save all search results for analysis timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") search_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f"cathedral_gallery_search_results_{timestamp}.json") with open(search_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_objective': 'Find emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with encircling galleries', 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'total_results': len(all_search_results), 'queries_executed': search_queries, 'all_results': all_search_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"üìÅ Search results saved to: {search_results_file}") # Analyze results for emperor and cathedral connections print("\n=== ANALYZING RESULTS FOR EMPEROR-CATHEDRAL CONNECTIONS ===") print("=" * 70) # Categorize results by relevance emperor_results = [] cathedral_gallery_results = [] aachen_results = [] charlemagne_results = [] otto_results = [] holy_roman_results = [] for result in all_search_results: title_lower = result['title'].lower() snippet_lower = result['snippet'].lower() combined = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower}" # Categorize by key terms if any(term in combined for term in ['emperor', 'imperial', 'charlemagne', 'otto']): emperor_results.append(result) if any(term in combined for term in ['gallery', 'encircling', 'walkway', 'arcade']): cathedral_gallery_results.append(result) if 'aachen' in combined: aachen_results.append(result) if 'charlemagne' in combined: charlemagne_results.append(result) if 'otto' in combined: otto_results.append(result) if 'holy roman' in combined: holy_roman_results.append(result) print(f"üìä CATEGORIZED RESULTS:") print(f"Emperor-related results: {len(emperor_results)}") print(f"Cathedral gallery results: {len(cathedral_gallery_results)}") print(f"Aachen-related results: {len(aachen_results)}") print(f"Charlemagne-related results: {len(charlemagne_results)}") print(f"Otto-related results: {len(otto_results)}") print(f"Holy Roman Empire results: {len(holy_roman_results)}") # Display most promising results print("\n=== MOST PROMISING RESULTS ===") print("=" * 50) if charlemagne_results: print("\nüëë CHARLEMAGNE-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(charlemagne_results[:3], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:250]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 250 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f" Search #{result['search_number']}, Result #{result['result_number']}") if aachen_results: print("\nüè∞ AACHEN CATHEDRAL RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(aachen_results[:3], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:250]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 250 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if cathedral_gallery_results: print("\nüèõÔ∏è CATHEDRAL GALLERY ARCHITECTURE RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(cathedral_gallery_results[:4], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:250]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 250 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if otto_results: print("\nüëë OTTO-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(otto_results[:2], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:250]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 250 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"\n=== STEP 3: ACCESSING PROMISING SOURCES ===") print("=" * 60) # Access the most promising web sources for detailed information headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Select top results for detailed analysis top_results = [] # Add top Charlemagne results if charlemagne_results: top_results.extend(charlemagne_results[:2]) # Add top Aachen results if aachen_results: top_results.extend(aachen_results[:2]) # Add top cathedral gallery results if cathedral_gallery_results: top_results.extend(cathedral_gallery_results[:2]) # Remove duplicates based on URL seen_urls = set() unique_top_results = [] for result in top_results: if result['link'] not in seen_urls: unique_top_results.append(result) seen_urls.add(result['link']) print(f"Accessing {len(unique_top_results)} unique top sources for detailed analysis...\n") for i, result in enumerate(unique_top_results, 1): print(f"--- Source {i}/{len(unique_top_results)}: {result['title']} ---") print(f"URL: {result['link']}") try: response = requests.get(result['link'], headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed (Content: {len(response.content):,} bytes)") soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for element in soup(["script", "style"]): element.decompose() page_text = soup.get_text() # Save the page content filename = f"cathedral_source_{i}_{timestamp}.html" filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"üìÅ Saved to: {filename}") # Look for key information about emperors and galleries print(f"üîç Analyzing content for emperor-gallery connections...") # Search for specific patterns emperor_gallery_patterns = [ r'[Cc]harlemagne.{0,100}[Gg]aller.{0,100}', r'[Ee]mperor.{0,100}[Gg]aller.{0,100}[Cc]athedral', r'[Aa]achen.{0,100}[Gg]aller.{0,100}', r'[Gg]aller.{0,100}encircl.{0,100}', r'first.{0,50}[Gg]aller.{0,50}cathedral', r'[Hh]oly [Rr]oman.{0,100}[Cc]athedral.{0,100}[Gg]aller' ] found_patterns = [] for j, pattern in enumerate(emperor_gallery_patterns, 1): matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) for match in matches: context = match.group().strip() if len(context) > 20: found_patterns.append({ 'pattern_number': j, 'context': context, 'start_pos': match.start() }) if found_patterns: print(f"üéØ Found {len(found_patterns)} relevant patterns:") for pattern in found_patterns[:3]: # Show top 3 print(f" Pattern {pattern['pattern_number']}: {pattern['context'][:150]}...") else: print(f"‚ùå No specific emperor-gallery patterns found") # Look for key terms frequency key_terms = ['charlemagne', 'emperor', 'gallery', 'aachen', 'cathedral', 'encircling', 'otto'] term_counts = {} for term in key_terms: count = len(re.findall(term, page_text, re.IGNORECASE)) if count > 0: term_counts[term] = count if term_counts: print(f"üìä Key term frequencies: {term_counts}") elif response.status_code == 403: print(f"‚ùå Access forbidden (403)") elif response.status_code == 404: print(f"‚ùå Page not found (404)") else: print(f"‚ùå HTTP error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing source: {str(e)}") print() time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting print(f"\n=== INITIAL RESEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ===") print(f"üìÅ Files created in workspace:") for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f" - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)") print(f"\nüéØ RESEARCH FOCUS AREAS IDENTIFIED:") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Charlemagne and Aachen Cathedral: {len(charlemagne_results) + len(aachen_results)} results") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Cathedral gallery architecture: {len(cathedral_gallery_results)} results") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Holy Roman Empire connections: {len(holy_roman_results)} results") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Otto-related cathedral projects: {len(otto_results)} results") print(f"\nüìä Next step: Analyze saved HTML content for specific emperor-cathedral-gallery connections") print(f"üîç Looking for: Emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with complete encircling galleries") print(f"üéØ Target: Identify the first cathedral with this architectural innovation and its imperial patron") print(f"\n=== READY FOR DETAILED CONTENT ANALYSIS ===")
Execution Output
Code Output: === RESEARCHING EMPERORS AND CATHEDRAL GALLERY EXPANSIONS === Objective: Find emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with encircling galleries Focus: Holy Roman Empire period, distinctive gallery architecture Target: Cathedrals with complete encircling galleries as first architectural innovation ‚úÖ SerpAPI key found, using Google Search API === STEP 1: TARGETED SEARCHES FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERY ARCHITECTURE === ================================================================================ Search 1/10: 'cathedral gallery encircling building Holy Roman Emperor' ---------------------------------------------------------------------- ‚úÖ Found 9 results Result 1: Title: Speyer Cathedral Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speyer_Cathedral Snippet: ... buildings were restored in the Romanesque and Gothic style of the Holy Roman Empire. ... The eastern apsidal end, showing the encircling gallery. Speyer ... ‚ùå SerpAPI search error: name 'combined_text' is not defined Found 10 results Processing result 1: 214 chars ‚ùå Search error: name 'full_text' is not defined ================================================================================ Search 2/10: 'first cathedral complete gallery architecture medieval' Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code contains multiple critical bugs that prevent proper execution. The main error is 'name 'combined_text' is not defined' occurring repeatedly during search processing, which breaks the core search functionality after each query. Additionally, there's a 'name 'combined' is not defined' error in the result analysis section at line 195. The code managed to collect 10 search results and save them to a JSON file, but the variable definition errors prevented proper categorization and analysis of the results. While some promising results were found (Speyer Cathedral with 'encircling gallery', Aachen Cathedral with Charlemagne connection, Ottonian architecture), the execution crashed before completing the analysis phase. **PLAN** alignment: 30% - search queries executed correctly but analysis failed due to bugs. Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime import re print("=== RESEARCHING EMPERORS AND CATHEDRAL GALLERY EXPANSIONS ===") print("Objective: Find emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with encircling galleries") print("Focus: Holy Roman Empire period, distinctive gallery architecture") print("Target: Cathedrals with complete encircling galleries as first architectural innovation\n") # Create workspace directory workspace_dir = "workspace" os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # Get SerpAPI key from environment variables api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("Warning: No SERPAPI_API_KEY found. Will attempt alternative search methods.") use_serpapi = False else: print("‚úÖ SerpAPI key found, using Google Search API") use_serpapi = True print("\n=== STEP 1: TARGETED SEARCHES FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERY ARCHITECTURE ===") print("=" * 80) # Define comprehensive search queries focusing on cathedral galleries and emperors search_queries = [ "cathedral gallery encircling building Holy Roman Emperor", "first cathedral complete gallery architecture medieval", "Holy Roman Emperor cathedral expansion gallery construction", "medieval cathedral architectural innovations encircling gallery", "emperor commissioned cathedral gallery around entire building", "Charlemagne cathedral gallery architecture Aachen", "Otto Holy Roman Emperor cathedral construction gallery", "medieval cathedral gallery walkway encircling building", "first cathedral with complete encircling gallery innovation", "Holy Roman Empire cathedral architectural features gallery" ] all_search_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: '{query}'") print("-" * 70) if use_serpapi: try: # Use SerpAPI for comprehensive results params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 10, "type": "search" } response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() if results.get("organic_results"): print(f"‚úÖ Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results") for j, result in enumerate(results["organic_results"], 1): title = result.get('title', 'No title') link = result.get('link', 'No link') snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\nResult {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:200]}..." if len(snippet) > 200 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Store comprehensive result data all_search_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'search_method': 'serpapi' }) # FIXED: Define combined_text properly in the correct scope combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" key_terms = ['emperor', 'gallery', 'cathedral', 'encircling', 'charlemagne', 'otto', 'holy roman', 'aachen', 'architectural'] relevance_score = sum(1 for term in key_terms if term in combined_text) if relevance_score >= 4: print("üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE - Contains multiple key terms!") elif relevance_score >= 2: print("üìù Moderate relevance") print("-" * 40) else: print(f"‚ùå No results found for query: '{query}'") else: print(f"‚ùå SerpAPI error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå SerpAPI search error: {str(e)}") else: # Fallback to DuckDuckGo if SerpAPI not available try: from ddgs import DDGS searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) results = searcher.text(query, max_results=8, backend=["duckduckgo", "bing"], safesearch="off") if results: print(f"‚úÖ Found {len(results)} results via DuckDuckGo") for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', 'No title') link = result.get('href', 'No link') snippet = result.get('body', 'No snippet') print(f"\nResult {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:200]}..." if len(snippet) > 200 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") all_search_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'search_method': 'duckduckgo' }) print("-" * 40) else: print(f"‚ùå No results found for query: '{query}'") except ImportError: print("‚ùå DuckDuckGo search not available, skipping this query") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå DuckDuckGo search error: {str(e)}") # Rate limiting time.sleep(2) print("\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS ===") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_search_results)}") print("=" * 60) # Save all search results for analysis timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") search_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f"cathedral_gallery_search_results_{timestamp}.json") with open(search_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_objective': 'Find emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with encircling galleries', 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'total_results': len(all_search_results), 'queries_executed': search_queries, 'all_results': all_search_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"üìÅ Search results saved to: {search_results_file}") # Analyze results for emperor and cathedral connections print("\n=== ANALYZING RESULTS FOR EMPEROR-CATHEDRAL CONNECTIONS ===") print("=" * 70) # Categorize results by relevance emperor_results = [] cathedral_gallery_results = [] aachen_results = [] charlemagne_results = [] otto_results = [] holy_roman_results = [] for result in all_search_results: title_lower = result['title'].lower() snippet_lower = result['snippet'].lower() combined = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower}" # Categorize by key terms if any(term in combined for term in ['emperor', 'imperial', 'charlemagne', 'otto']): emperor_results.append(result) if any(term in combined for term in ['gallery', 'encircling', 'walkway', 'arcade']): cathedral_gallery_results.append(result) if 'aachen' in combined: aachen_results.append(result) if 'charlemagne' in combined: charlemagne_results.append(result) if 'otto' in combined: otto_results.append(result) if 'holy roman' in combined: holy_roman_results.append(result) print(f"üìä CATEGORIZED RESULTS:") print(f"Emperor-related results: {len(emperor_results)}") print(f"Cathedral gallery results: {len(cathedral_gallery_results)}") print(f"Aachen-related results: {len(aachen_results)}") print(f"Charlemagne-related results: {len(charlemagne_results)}") print(f"Otto-related results: {len(otto_results)}") print(f"Holy Roman Empire results: {len(holy_roman_results)}") # Display most promising results print("\n=== MOST PROMISING RESULTS ===") print("=" * 50) if charlemagne_results: print("\nüëë CHARLEMAGNE-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(charlemagne_results[:3], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:250]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 250 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f" Search #{result['search_number']}, Result #{result['result_number']}") if aachen_results: print("\nüè∞ AACHEN CATHEDRAL RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(aachen_results[:3], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:250]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 250 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if cathedral_gallery_results: print("\nüèõÔ∏è CATHEDRAL GALLERY ARCHITECTURE RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(cathedral_gallery_results[:4], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:250]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 250 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if otto_results: print("\nüëë OTTO-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(otto_results[:2], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:250]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 250 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"\n=== STEP 3: ACCESSING PROMISING SOURCES ===") print("=" * 60) # Access the most promising web sources for detailed information headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Select top results for detailed analysis top_results = [] # Add top Charlemagne results if charlemagne_results: top_results.extend(charlemagne_results[:2]) # Add top Aachen results if aachen_results: top_results.extend(aachen_results[:2]) # Add top cathedral gallery results if cathedral_gallery_results: top_results.extend(cathedral_gallery_results[:2]) # Remove duplicates based on URL seen_urls = set() unique_top_results = [] for result in top_results: if result['link'] not in seen_urls: unique_top_results.append(result) seen_urls.add(result['link']) print(f"Accessing {len(unique_top_results)} unique top sources for detailed analysis...\n") for i, result in enumerate(unique_top_results, 1): print(f"--- Source {i}/{len(unique_top_results)}: {result['title']} ---") print(f"URL: {result['link']}") try: response = requests.get(result['link'], headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed (Content: {len(response.content):,} bytes)") soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for element in soup(["script", "style"]): element.decompose() page_text = soup.get_text() # Save the page content filename = f"cathedral_source_{i}_{timestamp}.html" filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"üìÅ Saved to: {filename}") # Look for key information about emperors and galleries print(f"üîç Analyzing content for emperor-gallery connections...") # Search for specific patterns emperor_gallery_patterns = [ r'[Cc]harlemagne.{0,100}[Gg]aller.{0,100}', r'[Ee]mperor.{0,100}[Gg]aller.{0,100}[Cc]athedral', r'[Aa]achen.{0,100}[Gg]aller.{0,100}', r'[Gg]aller.{0,100}encircl.{0,100}', r'first.{0,50}[Gg]aller.{0,50}cathedral', r'[Hh]oly [Rr]oman.{0,100}[Cc]athedral.{0,100}[Gg]aller' ] found_patterns = [] for j, pattern in enumerate(emperor_gallery_patterns, 1): matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) for match in matches: context = match.group().strip() if len(context) > 20: found_patterns.append({ 'pattern_number': j, 'context': context, 'start_pos': match.start() }) if found_patterns: print(f"üéØ Found {len(found_patterns)} relevant patterns:") for pattern in found_patterns[:3]: # Show top 3 print(f" Pattern {pattern['pattern_number']}: {pattern['context'][:150]}...") else: print(f"‚ùå No specific emperor-gallery patterns found") # Look for key terms frequency key_terms = ['charlemagne', 'emperor', 'gallery', 'aachen', 'cathedral', 'encircling', 'otto'] term_counts = {} for term in key_terms: count = len(re.findall(term, page_text, re.IGNORECASE)) if count > 0: term_counts[term] = count if term_counts: print(f"üìä Key term frequencies: {term_counts}") elif response.status_code == 403: print(f"‚ùå Access forbidden (403)") elif response.status_code == 404: print(f"‚ùå Page not found (404)") else: print(f"‚ùå HTTP error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing source: {str(e)}") print() time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting print(f"\n=== INITIAL RESEARCH PHASE COMPLETE ===") print(f"üìÅ Files created in workspace:") for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f" - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)") print(f"\nüéØ RESEARCH FOCUS AREAS IDENTIFIED:") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Charlemagne and Aachen Cathedral: {len(charlemagne_results) + len(aachen_results)} results") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Cathedral gallery architecture: {len(cathedral_gallery_results)} results") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Holy Roman Empire connections: {len(holy_roman_results)} results") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Otto-related cathedral projects: {len(otto_results)} results") print(f"\nüìä Next step: Analyze saved HTML content for specific emperor-cathedral-gallery connections") print(f"üîç Looking for: Emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with complete encircling galleries") print(f"üéØ Target: Identify the first cathedral with this architectural innovation and its imperial patron") print(f"\n=== READY FOR DETAILED CONTENT ANALYSIS ===")

Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 3)

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime print("=== ANALYZING CATHEDRAL GALLERY SEARCH RESULTS ===") print("Objective: Examine collected search data for emperor-cathedral-gallery connections") print("Focus: Fix variable errors and properly analyze the search results\n") # First, let's inspect what files we have in the workspace workspace_dir = "workspace" if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): print("Files in workspace:") for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f" - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print("‚ùå Workspace directory not found") exit() # Find the search results JSON file search_files = [f for f in os.listdir(workspace_dir) if f.startswith('cathedral_gallery_search_results_') and f.endswith('.json')] if not search_files: print("‚ùå No cathedral gallery search results found") exit() # Use the most recent search results file search_file = search_files[-1] # Get the latest file print(f"\n=== ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FILE: {search_file} ===") print("=" * 70) filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, search_file) # First, inspect the JSON structure print("Step 1: Inspecting JSON file structure...") try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully loaded JSON file") print(f"File type: {type(search_data).__name__}") if isinstance(search_data, dict): print(f"Top-level keys: {list(search_data.keys())}") # Inspect each key for key, value in search_data.items(): if key == 'all_results' and isinstance(value, list): print(f" - {key}: list with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0: print(f" Sample result keys: {list(value[0].keys()) if isinstance(value[0], dict) else 'Not a dict'}") else: print(f" - {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {str(value)[:100]}..." if len(str(value)) > 100 else f" - {key}: {value}") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error loading JSON: {e}") exit() print("\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERIES ===") print("=" * 70) # Extract and analyze the search results all_results = search_data.get('all_results', []) print(f"Total search results to analyze: {len(all_results)}") if not all_results: print("‚ùå No search results found in the data") exit() # Categorize results by relevance - FIXED variable scope issues emperor_results = [] cathedral_gallery_results = [] aachen_results = [] charlemagne_results = [] otto_results = [] holy_roman_results = [] speyer_results = [] print("\nAnalyzing each search result for relevance...") for i, result in enumerate(all_results, 1): # Safely extract result data title = result.get('title', 'No title') snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet') link = result.get('link', 'No link') query = result.get('query', 'No query') print(f"\nResult {i}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Query: {query}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") # PROPERLY DEFINE combined_text in correct scope title_lower = title.lower() snippet_lower = snippet.lower() combined_text = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower}" # Categorize by key terms - FIXED variable reference relevance_indicators = [] if any(term in combined_text for term in ['emperor', 'imperial', 'charlemagne', 'otto']): emperor_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Emperor') if any(term in combined_text for term in ['gallery', 'encircling', 'walkway', 'arcade']): cathedral_gallery_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Gallery') if 'aachen' in combined_text: aachen_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Aachen') if 'charlemagne' in combined_text: charlemagne_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Charlemagne') if 'otto' in combined_text: otto_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Otto') if 'holy roman' in combined_text: holy_roman_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Holy Roman') if 'speyer' in combined_text: speyer_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Speyer') # Calculate relevance score key_terms = ['emperor', 'gallery', 'cathedral', 'encircling', 'charlemagne', 'otto', 'holy roman', 'aachen', 'speyer'] relevance_score = sum(1 for term in key_terms if term in combined_text) print(f" Relevance Score: {relevance_score}") print(f" Categories: {', '.join(relevance_indicators) if relevance_indicators else 'None'}") if relevance_score >= 4: print(" üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE - Multiple key terms!") elif relevance_score >= 2: print(" üìù Moderate relevance") else: print(" ‚ùå Low relevance") print("\n=== CATEGORIZATION RESULTS ===") print("=" * 50) print(f"üìä CATEGORIZED RESULTS:") print(f"Emperor-related results: {len(emperor_results)}") print(f"Cathedral gallery results: {len(cathedral_gallery_results)}") print(f"Aachen-related results: {len(aachen_results)}") print(f"Charlemagne-related results: {len(charlemagne_results)}") print(f"Otto-related results: {len(otto_results)}") print(f"Holy Roman Empire results: {len(holy_roman_results)}") print(f"Speyer Cathedral results: {len(speyer_results)}") # Display most promising results print("\n=== MOST PROMISING RESULTS FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERIES ===") print("=" * 60) if charlemagne_results: print("\nüëë CHARLEMAGNE-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(charlemagne_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if aachen_results: print("\nüè∞ AACHEN CATHEDRAL RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(aachen_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if speyer_results: print("\nüèõÔ∏è SPEYER CATHEDRAL RESULTS (with encircling gallery):") for i, result in enumerate(speyer_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if cathedral_gallery_results: print("\nüèõÔ∏è CATHEDRAL GALLERY ARCHITECTURE RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(cathedral_gallery_results[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if otto_results: print("\nüëë OTTO-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(otto_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print("\n=== KEY FINDINGS ANALYSIS ===") print("=" * 50) # Analyze key findings from the search results key_findings = [] # Check for Speyer Cathedral with encircling gallery for result in speyer_results: if 'encircling gallery' in result['snippet'].lower(): key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Architectural Feature', 'finding': 'Speyer Cathedral has an encircling gallery', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) # Check for Charlemagne and Aachen connections for result in charlemagne_results + aachen_results: if 'charlemagne' in result['snippet'].lower() and ('aachen' in result['snippet'].lower() or 'gallery' in result['snippet'].lower()): key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Imperial Connection', 'finding': 'Charlemagne connection to Aachen Cathedral', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) # Check for Otto and cathedral connections for result in otto_results: if 'cathedral' in result['snippet'].lower() or 'architecture' in result['snippet'].lower(): key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Imperial Architecture', 'finding': 'Otto connection to cathedral architecture', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) print(f"üîç KEY FINDINGS IDENTIFIED: {len(key_findings)}") for i, finding in enumerate(key_findings, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {finding['type']}: {finding['finding']}") print(f" Source: {finding['source']}") print(f" Link: {finding['link']}") print(f" Evidence: {finding['evidence'][:150]}..." if len(finding['evidence']) > 150 else f" Evidence: {finding['evidence']}") # Save analysis results analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Find emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with encircling galleries', 'total_results_analyzed': len(all_results), 'categorization': { 'emperor_results': len(emperor_results), 'cathedral_gallery_results': len(cathedral_gallery_results), 'aachen_results': len(aachen_results), 'charlemagne_results': len(charlemagne_results), 'otto_results': len(otto_results), 'holy_roman_results': len(holy_roman_results), 'speyer_results': len(speyer_results) }, 'key_findings': key_findings, 'promising_sources': { 'charlemagne_sources': [r['link'] for r in charlemagne_results], 'aachen_sources': [r['link'] for r in aachen_results], 'speyer_sources': [r['link'] for r in speyer_results], 'otto_sources': [r['link'] for r in otto_results] } } timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f"cathedral_gallery_analysis_{timestamp}.json") with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÅ Analysis results saved to: {analysis_file}") print("\n=== RESEARCH DIRECTION IDENTIFIED ===") print("=" * 50) print("üéØ MOST PROMISING LEADS:") print("1. Speyer Cathedral - Explicitly mentions 'encircling gallery'") print("2. Aachen Cathedral - Connected to Emperor Charlemagne") print("3. Ottonian architecture - Connected to Emperor Otto") print("4. Holy Roman Empire cathedral architecture") print("\nüìä NEXT STEPS:") print("1. Access detailed content from Speyer Cathedral Wikipedia page") print("2. Research Aachen Cathedral's architectural features") print("3. Investigate Ottonian architectural innovations") print("4. Look for specific emperor-commissioned gallery expansions") print("\n‚úÖ ANALYSIS COMPLETE - Ready for detailed source investigation")

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime print("=== ANALYZING CATHEDRAL GALLERY SEARCH RESULTS ===") print("Objective: Examine collected search data for emperor-cathedral-gallery connections") print("Focus: Fix variable errors and properly analyze the search results\n") # First, let's inspect what files we have in the workspace workspace_dir = "workspace" if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): print("Files in workspace:") for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f" - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print("‚ùå Workspace directory not found") exit() # Find the search results JSON file search_files = [f for f in os.listdir(workspace_dir) if f.startswith('cathedral_gallery_search_results_') and f.endswith('.json')] if not search_files: print("‚ùå No cathedral gallery search results found") exit() # Use the most recent search results file search_file = search_files[-1] # Get the latest file print(f"\n=== ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FILE: {search_file} ===") print("=" * 70) filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, search_file) # First, inspect the JSON structure print("Step 1: Inspecting JSON file structure...") try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully loaded JSON file") print(f"File type: {type(search_data).__name__}") if isinstance(search_data, dict): print(f"Top-level keys: {list(search_data.keys())}") # Inspect each key for key, value in search_data.items(): if key == 'all_results' and isinstance(value, list): print(f" - {key}: list with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0: print(f" Sample result keys: {list(value[0].keys()) if isinstance(value[0], dict) else 'Not a dict'}") else: print(f" - {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {str(value)[:100]}..." if len(str(value)) > 100 else f" - {key}: {value}") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error loading JSON: {e}") exit() print("\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERIES ===") print("=" * 70) # Extract and analyze the search results all_results = search_data.get('all_results', []) print(f"Total search results to analyze: {len(all_results)}") if not all_results: print("‚ùå No search results found in the data") exit() # Categorize results by relevance - FIXED variable scope issues emperor_results = [] cathedral_gallery_results = [] aachen_results = [] charlemagne_results = [] otto_results = [] holy_roman_results = [] speyer_results = [] print("\nAnalyzing each search result for relevance...") for i, result in enumerate(all_results, 1): # Safely extract result data title = result.get('title', 'No title') snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet') link = result.get('link', 'No link') query = result.get('query', 'No query') print(f"\nResult {i}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Query: {query}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") # PROPERLY DEFINE combined_text in correct scope title_lower = title.lower() snippet_lower = snippet.lower() combined_text = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower}" # Categorize by key terms - FIXED variable reference relevance_indicators = [] if any(term in combined_text for term in ['emperor', 'imperial', 'charlemagne', 'otto']): emperor_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Emperor') if any(term in combined_text for term in ['gallery', 'encircling', 'walkway', 'arcade']): cathedral_gallery_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Gallery') if 'aachen' in combined_text: aachen_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Aachen') if 'charlemagne' in combined_text: charlemagne_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Charlemagne') if 'otto' in combined_text: otto_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Otto') if 'holy roman' in combined_text: holy_roman_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Holy Roman') if 'speyer' in combined_text: speyer_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Speyer') # Calculate relevance score key_terms = ['emperor', 'gallery', 'cathedral', 'encircling', 'charlemagne', 'otto', 'holy roman', 'aachen', 'speyer'] relevance_score = sum(1 for term in key_terms if term in combined_text) print(f" Relevance Score: {relevance_score}") print(f" Categories: {', '.join(relevance_indicators) if relevance_indicators else 'None'}") if relevance_score >= 4: print(" üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE - Multiple key terms!") elif relevance_score >= 2: print(" üìù Moderate relevance") else: print(" ‚ùå Low relevance") print("\n=== CATEGORIZATION RESULTS ===") print("=" * 50) print(f"üìä CATEGORIZED RESULTS:") print(f"Emperor-related results: {len(emperor_results)}") print(f"Cathedral gallery results: {len(cathedral_gallery_results)}") print(f"Aachen-related results: {len(aachen_results)}") print(f"Charlemagne-related results: {len(charlemagne_results)}") print(f"Otto-related results: {len(otto_results)}") print(f"Holy Roman Empire results: {len(holy_roman_results)}") print(f"Speyer Cathedral results: {len(speyer_results)}") # Display most promising results print("\n=== MOST PROMISING RESULTS FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERIES ===") print("=" * 60) if charlemagne_results: print("\nüëë CHARLEMAGNE-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(charlemagne_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if aachen_results: print("\nüè∞ AACHEN CATHEDRAL RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(aachen_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if speyer_results: print("\nüèõÔ∏è SPEYER CATHEDRAL RESULTS (with encircling gallery):") for i, result in enumerate(speyer_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if cathedral_gallery_results: print("\nüèõÔ∏è CATHEDRAL GALLERY ARCHITECTURE RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(cathedral_gallery_results[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if otto_results: print("\nüëë OTTO-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(otto_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print("\n=== KEY FINDINGS ANALYSIS ===") print("=" * 50) # Analyze key findings from the search results key_findings = [] # Check for Speyer Cathedral with encircling gallery for result in speyer_results: if 'encircling gallery' in result['snippet'].lower(): key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Architectural Feature', 'finding': 'Speyer Cathedral has an encircling gallery', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) # Check for Charlemagne and Aachen connections for result in charlemagne_results + aachen_results: if 'charlemagne' in result['snippet'].lower() and ('aachen' in result['snippet'].lower() or 'gallery' in result['snippet'].lower()): key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Imperial Connection', 'finding': 'Charlemagne connection to Aachen Cathedral', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) # Check for Otto and cathedral connections for result in otto_results: if 'cathedral' in result['snippet'].lower() or 'architecture' in result['snippet'].lower(): key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Imperial Architecture', 'finding': 'Otto connection to cathedral architecture', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) print(f"üîç KEY FINDINGS IDENTIFIED: {len(key_findings)}") for i, finding in enumerate(key_findings, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {finding['type']}: {finding['finding']}") print(f" Source: {finding['source']}") print(f" Link: {finding['link']}") print(f" Evidence: {finding['evidence'][:150]}..." if len(finding['evidence']) > 150 else f" Evidence: {finding['evidence']}") # Save analysis results analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Find emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with encircling galleries', 'total_results_analyzed': len(all_results), 'categorization': { 'emperor_results': len(emperor_results), 'cathedral_gallery_results': len(cathedral_gallery_results), 'aachen_results': len(aachen_results), 'charlemagne_results': len(charlemagne_results), 'otto_results': len(otto_results), 'holy_roman_results': len(holy_roman_results), 'speyer_results': len(speyer_results) }, 'key_findings': key_findings, 'promising_sources': { 'charlemagne_sources': [r['link'] for r in charlemagne_results], 'aachen_sources': [r['link'] for r in aachen_results], 'speyer_sources': [r['link'] for r in speyer_results], 'otto_sources': [r['link'] for r in otto_results] } } timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f"cathedral_gallery_analysis_{timestamp}.json") with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÅ Analysis results saved to: {analysis_file}") print("\n=== RESEARCH DIRECTION IDENTIFIED ===") print("=" * 50) print("üéØ MOST PROMISING LEADS:") print("1. Speyer Cathedral - Explicitly mentions 'encircling gallery'") print("2. Aachen Cathedral - Connected to Emperor Charlemagne") print("3. Ottonian architecture - Connected to Emperor Otto") print("4. Holy Roman Empire cathedral architecture") print("\nüìä NEXT STEPS:") print("1. Access detailed content from Speyer Cathedral Wikipedia page") print("2. Research Aachen Cathedral's architectural features") print("3. Investigate Ottonian architectural innovations") print("4. Look for specific emperor-commissioned gallery expansions") print("\n‚úÖ ANALYSIS COMPLETE - Ready for detailed source investigation")

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime print("=== ANALYZING CATHEDRAL GALLERY SEARCH RESULTS ===") print("Objective: Examine collected search data for emperor-cathedral-gallery connections") print("Focus: Fix variable scope errors and properly analyze the search results\n") # First, let's inspect what files we have in the workspace workspace_dir = "workspace" if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): print("Files in workspace:") for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f" - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print("‚ùå Workspace directory not found") exit() # Find the search results JSON file search_files = [f for f in os.listdir(workspace_dir) if f.startswith('cathedral_gallery_search_results_') and f.endswith('.json')] if not search_files: print("‚ùå No cathedral gallery search results found") exit() # Use the most recent search results file search_file = search_files[-1] # Get the latest file print(f"\n=== ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FILE: {search_file} ===") print("=" * 70) filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, search_file) # First, inspect the JSON structure safely print("Step 1: Inspecting JSON file structure...") try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully loaded JSON file") print(f"File type: {type(search_data).__name__}") if isinstance(search_data, dict): print(f"Top-level keys: {list(search_data.keys())}") # Inspect each key safely for key, value in search_data.items(): if key == 'all_results' and isinstance(value, list): print(f" - {key}: list with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0 and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" Sample result keys: {list(value[0].keys())}") else: value_str = str(value) if len(value_str) > 100: print(f" - {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {value_str[:100]}...") else: print(f" - {key}: {value}") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error loading JSON: {e}") exit() print("\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERIES ===") print("=" * 70) # Extract and analyze the search results all_results = search_data.get('all_results', []) print(f"Total search results to analyze: {len(all_results)}") if not all_results: print("‚ùå No search results found in the data") exit() # Initialize categorization lists emperor_results = [] cathedral_gallery_results = [] aachen_results = [] charlemagne_results = [] otto_results = [] holy_roman_results = [] speyer_results = [] print("\nAnalyzing each search result for relevance...") for i, result in enumerate(all_results, 1): # Safely extract result data title = result.get('title', 'No title') snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet') link = result.get('link', 'No link') query = result.get('query', 'No query') print(f"\nResult {i}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Query: {query}") print(f" Link: {link}") if len(snippet) > 150: print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {snippet}") # PROPERLY DEFINE combined_text in correct scope BEFORE using it title_lower = title.lower() snippet_lower = snippet.lower() combined_text = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower}" # Now categorize by key terms with combined_text properly defined relevance_indicators = [] # Check for emperor-related terms emperor_terms = ['emperor', 'imperial', 'charlemagne', 'otto'] if any(term in combined_text for term in emperor_terms): emperor_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Emperor') # Check for gallery-related terms gallery_terms = ['gallery', 'encircling', 'walkway', 'arcade'] if any(term in combined_text for term in gallery_terms): cathedral_gallery_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Gallery') # Check for specific locations and figures if 'aachen' in combined_text: aachen_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Aachen') if 'charlemagne' in combined_text: charlemagne_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Charlemagne') if 'otto' in combined_text: otto_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Otto') if 'holy roman' in combined_text: holy_roman_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Holy Roman') if 'speyer' in combined_text: speyer_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Speyer') # Calculate relevance score key_terms = ['emperor', 'gallery', 'cathedral', 'encircling', 'charlemagne', 'otto', 'holy roman', 'aachen', 'speyer'] relevance_score = sum(1 for term in key_terms if term in combined_text) print(f" Relevance Score: {relevance_score}") if relevance_indicators: print(f" Categories: {', '.join(relevance_indicators)}") else: print(f" Categories: None") if relevance_score >= 4: print(" üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE - Multiple key terms!") elif relevance_score >= 2: print(" üìù Moderate relevance") else: print(" ‚ùå Low relevance") print("\n=== CATEGORIZATION RESULTS ===") print("=" * 50) print(f"üìä CATEGORIZED RESULTS:") print(f"Emperor-related results: {len(emperor_results)}") print(f"Cathedral gallery results: {len(cathedral_gallery_results)}") print(f"Aachen-related results: {len(aachen_results)}") print(f"Charlemagne-related results: {len(charlemagne_results)}") print(f"Otto-related results: {len(otto_results)}") print(f"Holy Roman Empire results: {len(holy_roman_results)}") print(f"Speyer Cathedral results: {len(speyer_results)}") # Display most promising results print("\n=== MOST PROMISING RESULTS FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERIES ===") print("=" * 60) if speyer_results: print("\nüèõÔ∏è SPEYER CATHEDRAL RESULTS (with encircling gallery):") for i, result in enumerate(speyer_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") if len(result['snippet']) > 200: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if charlemagne_results: print("\nüëë CHARLEMAGNE-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(charlemagne_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") if len(result['snippet']) > 200: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if aachen_results: print("\nüè∞ AACHEN CATHEDRAL RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(aachen_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") if len(result['snippet']) > 200: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if otto_results: print("\nüëë OTTO-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(otto_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") if len(result['snippet']) > 200: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if cathedral_gallery_results: print("\nüèõÔ∏è CATHEDRAL GALLERY ARCHITECTURE RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(cathedral_gallery_results[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") if len(result['snippet']) > 200: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print("\n=== KEY FINDINGS ANALYSIS ===") print("=" * 50) # Analyze key findings from the search results key_findings = [] # Check for Speyer Cathedral with encircling gallery for result in speyer_results: if 'encircling gallery' in result['snippet'].lower(): key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Architectural Feature', 'finding': 'Speyer Cathedral has an encircling gallery', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) # Check for Charlemagne and Aachen connections for result in charlemagne_results + aachen_results: snippet_lower = result['snippet'].lower() if 'charlemagne' in snippet_lower and ('aachen' in snippet_lower or 'gallery' in snippet_lower): key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Imperial Connection', 'finding': 'Charlemagne connection to Aachen Cathedral', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) # Check for Otto and cathedral connections for result in otto_results: snippet_lower = result['snippet'].lower() if 'cathedral' in snippet_lower or 'architecture' in snippet_lower: key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Imperial Architecture', 'finding': 'Otto connection to cathedral architecture', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) # Check for Holy Roman Empire cathedral connections for result in holy_roman_results: snippet_lower = result['snippet'].lower() if 'cathedral' in snippet_lower and 'gallery' in snippet_lower: key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Holy Roman Empire Architecture', 'finding': 'Holy Roman Empire cathedral with gallery features', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) print(f"üîç KEY FINDINGS IDENTIFIED: {len(key_findings)}") for i, finding in enumerate(key_findings, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {finding['type']}: {finding['finding']}") print(f" Source: {finding['source']}") print(f" Link: {finding['link']}") if len(finding['evidence']) > 150: print(f" Evidence: {finding['evidence'][:150]}...") else: print(f" Evidence: {finding['evidence']}") # Save analysis results analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Find emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with encircling galleries', 'total_results_analyzed': len(all_results), 'categorization': { 'emperor_results': len(emperor_results), 'cathedral_gallery_results': len(cathedral_gallery_results), 'aachen_results': len(aachen_results), 'charlemagne_results': len(charlemagne_results), 'otto_results': len(otto_results), 'holy_roman_results': len(holy_roman_results), 'speyer_results': len(speyer_results) }, 'key_findings': key_findings, 'promising_sources': { 'speyer_sources': [r['link'] for r in speyer_results], 'charlemagne_sources': [r['link'] for r in charlemagne_results], 'aachen_sources': [r['link'] for r in aachen_results], 'otto_sources': [r['link'] for r in otto_results] } } timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f"cathedral_gallery_analysis_{timestamp}.json") with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÅ Analysis results saved to: {analysis_file}") print("\n=== RESEARCH DIRECTION IDENTIFIED ===") print("=" * 50) print("üéØ MOST PROMISING LEADS:") print("1. Speyer Cathedral - Explicitly mentions 'encircling gallery' in Holy Roman Empire context") print("2. Aachen Cathedral - Connected to Emperor Charlemagne") print("3. Ottonian architecture - Connected to Emperor Otto") print("4. Holy Roman Empire cathedral architecture with gallery features") print("\nüìä NEXT STEPS:") print("1. Access detailed content from Speyer Cathedral Wikipedia page") print("2. Research Aachen Cathedral's architectural features and Charlemagne's role") print("3. Investigate Ottonian architectural innovations") print("4. Look for specific emperor-commissioned gallery expansions") print("\n‚úÖ SEARCH RESULT ANALYSIS COMPLETE - Ready for detailed source investigation") print("üîç Focus: Identify which emperor first commissioned cathedral expansions with complete encircling galleries")

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code contains a persistent variable scope error that prevents completion of the search result analysis. Despite multiple attempts to fix the 'combined_text' variable definition issue, the error still occurs at line 112 when processing the first search result. The code successfully loads the JSON file with 10 search results and begins analyzing the first result (Speyer Cathedral with 'encircling gallery' mention), but crashes during the categorization phase. The variable 'combined_text' is being referenced in a generator expression context where it's not properly accessible. **PLAN** alignment: 45% - correct objective, successful data loading, but analysis fails due to technical bug. The search results look very promising (Speyer Cathedral explicitly mentions 'encircling gallery' in Holy Roman Empire context), but the execution cannot proceed past the first result. Immediate fix needed: Move the 'combined_text' variable definition to occur BEFORE any generator expressions or list comprehensions that reference it, ensuring proper variable scope throughout the categorization logic.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime print("=== ANALYZING CATHEDRAL GALLERY SEARCH RESULTS ===") print("Objective: Examine collected search data for emperor-cathedral-gallery connections") print("Focus: Fix variable scope errors and properly analyze the search results\n") # First, let's inspect what files we have in the workspace workspace_dir = "workspace" if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): print("Files in workspace:") for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f" - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print("‚ùå Workspace directory not found") exit() # Find the search results JSON file search_files = [f for f in os.listdir(workspace_dir) if f.startswith('cathedral_gallery_search_results_') and f.endswith('.json')] if not search_files: print("‚ùå No cathedral gallery search results found") exit() # Use the most recent search results file search_file = search_files[-1] # Get the latest file print(f"\n=== ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FILE: {search_file} ===") print("=" * 70) filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, search_file) # First, inspect the JSON structure safely print("Step 1: Inspecting JSON file structure...") try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully loaded JSON file") print(f"File type: {type(search_data).__name__}") if isinstance(search_data, dict): print(f"Top-level keys: {list(search_data.keys())}") # Inspect each key safely for key, value in search_data.items(): if key == 'all_results' and isinstance(value, list): print(f" - {key}: list with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0 and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" Sample result keys: {list(value[0].keys())}") else: value_str = str(value) if len(value_str) > 100: print(f" - {key}: {type(value).__name__} = {value_str[:100]}...") else: print(f" - {key}: {value}") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error loading JSON: {e}") exit() print("\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERIES ===") print("=" * 70) # Extract and analyze the search results all_results = search_data.get('all_results', []) print(f"Total search results to analyze: {len(all_results)}") if not all_results: print("‚ùå No search results found in the data") exit() # Initialize categorization lists emperor_results = [] cathedral_gallery_results = [] aachen_results = [] charlemagne_results = [] otto_results = [] holy_roman_results = [] speyer_results = [] print("\nAnalyzing each search result for relevance...") for i, result in enumerate(all_results, 1): # Safely extract result data title = result.get('title', 'No title') snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet') link = result.get('link', 'No link') query = result.get('query', 'No query') print(f"\nResult {i}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Query: {query}") print(f" Link: {link}") if len(snippet) > 150: print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {snippet}") # PROPERLY DEFINE combined_text in correct scope BEFORE using it title_lower = title.lower() snippet_lower = snippet.lower() combined_text = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower}" # Now categorize by key terms with combined_text properly defined relevance_indicators = [] # Check for emperor-related terms emperor_terms = ['emperor', 'imperial', 'charlemagne', 'otto'] if any(term in combined_text for term in emperor_terms): emperor_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Emperor') # Check for gallery-related terms gallery_terms = ['gallery', 'encircling', 'walkway', 'arcade'] if any(term in combined_text for term in gallery_terms): cathedral_gallery_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Gallery') # Check for specific locations and figures if 'aachen' in combined_text: aachen_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Aachen') if 'charlemagne' in combined_text: charlemagne_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Charlemagne') if 'otto' in combined_text: otto_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Otto') if 'holy roman' in combined_text: holy_roman_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Holy Roman') if 'speyer' in combined_text: speyer_results.append(result) relevance_indicators.append('Speyer') # Calculate relevance score key_terms = ['emperor', 'gallery', 'cathedral', 'encircling', 'charlemagne', 'otto', 'holy roman', 'aachen', 'speyer'] relevance_score = sum(1 for term in key_terms if term in combined_text) print(f" Relevance Score: {relevance_score}") if relevance_indicators: print(f" Categories: {', '.join(relevance_indicators)}") else: print(f" Categories: None") if relevance_score >= 4: print(" üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE - Multiple key terms!") elif relevance_score >= 2: print(" üìù Moderate relevance") else: print(" ‚ùå Low relevance") print("\n=== CATEGORIZATION RESULTS ===") print("=" * 50) print(f"üìä CATEGORIZED RESULTS:") print(f"Emperor-related results: {len(emperor_results)}") print(f"Cathedral gallery results: {len(cathedral_gallery_results)}") print(f"Aachen-related results: {len(aachen_results)}") print(f"Charlemagne-related results: {len(charlemagne_results)}") print(f"Otto-related results: {len(otto_results)}") print(f"Holy Roman Empire results: {len(holy_roman_results)}") print(f"Speyer Cathedral results: {len(speyer_results)}") # Display most promising results print("\n=== MOST PROMISING RESULTS FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERIES ===") print("=" * 60) if speyer_results: print("\nüèõÔ∏è SPEYER CATHEDRAL RESULTS (with encircling gallery):") for i, result in enumerate(speyer_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") if len(result['snippet']) > 200: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if charlemagne_results: print("\nüëë CHARLEMAGNE-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(charlemagne_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") if len(result['snippet']) > 200: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if aachen_results: print("\nüè∞ AACHEN CATHEDRAL RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(aachen_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") if len(result['snippet']) > 200: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if otto_results: print("\nüëë OTTO-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(otto_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") if len(result['snippet']) > 200: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if cathedral_gallery_results: print("\nüèõÔ∏è CATHEDRAL GALLERY ARCHITECTURE RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(cathedral_gallery_results[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") if len(result['snippet']) > 200: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}...") else: print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print("\n=== KEY FINDINGS ANALYSIS ===") print("=" * 50) # Analyze key findings from the search results key_findings = [] # Check for Speyer Cathedral with encircling gallery for result in speyer_results: if 'encircling gallery' in result['snippet'].lower(): key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Architectural Feature', 'finding': 'Speyer Cathedral has an encircling gallery', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) # Check for Charlemagne and Aachen connections for result in charlemagne_results + aachen_results: snippet_lower = result['snippet'].lower() if 'charlemagne' in snippet_lower and ('aachen' in snippet_lower or 'gallery' in snippet_lower): key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Imperial Connection', 'finding': 'Charlemagne connection to Aachen Cathedral', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) # Check for Otto and cathedral connections for result in otto_results: snippet_lower = result['snippet'].lower() if 'cathedral' in snippet_lower or 'architecture' in snippet_lower: key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Imperial Architecture', 'finding': 'Otto connection to cathedral architecture', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) # Check for Holy Roman Empire cathedral connections for result in holy_roman_results: snippet_lower = result['snippet'].lower() if 'cathedral' in snippet_lower and 'gallery' in snippet_lower: key_findings.append({ 'type': 'Holy Roman Empire Architecture', 'finding': 'Holy Roman Empire cathedral with gallery features', 'source': result['title'], 'link': result['link'], 'evidence': result['snippet'] }) print(f"üîç KEY FINDINGS IDENTIFIED: {len(key_findings)}") for i, finding in enumerate(key_findings, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {finding['type']}: {finding['finding']}") print(f" Source: {finding['source']}") print(f" Link: {finding['link']}") if len(finding['evidence']) > 150: print(f" Evidence: {finding['evidence'][:150]}...") else: print(f" Evidence: {finding['evidence']}") # Save analysis results analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Find emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with encircling galleries', 'total_results_analyzed': len(all_results), 'categorization': { 'emperor_results': len(emperor_results), 'cathedral_gallery_results': len(cathedral_gallery_results), 'aachen_results': len(aachen_results), 'charlemagne_results': len(charlemagne_results), 'otto_results': len(otto_results), 'holy_roman_results': len(holy_roman_results), 'speyer_results': len(speyer_results) }, 'key_findings': key_findings, 'promising_sources': { 'speyer_sources': [r['link'] for r in speyer_results], 'charlemagne_sources': [r['link'] for r in charlemagne_results], 'aachen_sources': [r['link'] for r in aachen_results], 'otto_sources': [r['link'] for r in otto_results] } } timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f"cathedral_gallery_analysis_{timestamp}.json") with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÅ Analysis results saved to: {analysis_file}") print("\n=== RESEARCH DIRECTION IDENTIFIED ===") print("=" * 50) print("üéØ MOST PROMISING LEADS:") print("1. Speyer Cathedral - Explicitly mentions 'encircling gallery' in Holy Roman Empire context") print("2. Aachen Cathedral - Connected to Emperor Charlemagne") print("3. Ottonian architecture - Connected to Emperor Otto") print("4. Holy Roman Empire cathedral architecture with gallery features") print("\nüìä NEXT STEPS:") print("1. Access detailed content from Speyer Cathedral Wikipedia page") print("2. Research Aachen Cathedral's architectural features and Charlemagne's role") print("3. Investigate Ottonian architectural innovations") print("4. Look for specific emperor-commissioned gallery expansions") print("\n‚úÖ SEARCH RESULT ANALYSIS COMPLETE - Ready for detailed source investigation") print("üîç Focus: Identify which emperor first commissioned cathedral expansions with complete encircling galleries")

Code Output: === ANALYZING CATHEDRAL GALLERY SEARCH RESULTS === Objective: Examine collected search data for emperor-cathedral-gallery connections Focus: Fix variable scope errors and properly analyze the search results Files in workspace: - cathedral_gallery_search_results_20250812_062325.json (5,585 bytes) - cathedral_gallery_search_results_20250812_062508.json (5,585 bytes) === ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FILE: cathedral_gallery_search_results_20250812_062508.json === ====================================================================== Step 1: Inspecting JSON file structure... ‚úÖ Successfully loaded JSON file File type: dict Top-level keys: ['search_timestamp', 'search_objective', 'total_queries', 'total_results', 'queries_executed', 'all_results'] - search_timestamp: 2025-08-12T06:25:08.896259 - search_objective: Find emperors who commissioned cathedral expansions with encircling galleries - total_queries: 10 - total_results: 10 - queries_executed: list = ['cathedral gallery encircling building Holy Roman Emperor', 'first cathedral complete gallery archi... - all_results: list with 10 items Sample result keys: ['search_number', 'query', 'result_number', 'title', 'link', 'snippet', 'search_method'] === STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR CATHEDRAL GALLERIES === ====================================================================== Total search results to analyze: 10 Analyzing each search result for relevance...
